definition[0]: to feel better quickly after being ill, or to become successful again after failing or having been defeated
example[0]: The company’s had a lot of problems in the past, but it’s always managed to bounce back.
definition[1]: if an email that you send bounces back or is bounced back, it is returned to you and the other person does not receive it because of a technical problem
definition[2]: to quickly increase or become successful again after falling or having problems
example[1]: The shares dropped to 430p, before bouncing back to close at 468p.
